title: Six of a family suffer burn injuries in Dhaka blast from ‘gas leak’
body: Six members of a family, including a six-year-old girl, suffered burn injuries after a gas leak triggered a fire in their house in Dhaka’s Agargaon early Saturday. The incident occurred in the Agargaon Paka Market area at about 4:30am, the police said. The victims are Md Jalil Mia, 50, Aneja Begum, 40, Asif Mia, 19, Sakib Mia, 16, Eva, 6, and Monira Akter, 17. All six victims are undergoing treatment at the burn unit of Dhaka Medical College Hospital, according to Md Faruk, in-charge of the DMCH police outpost. Jalil and Arneja sustained burns to 12 per cent and 10 per cent of their bodies respectively, while the others suffered burns mainly to their hands and feet, according to the on-duty doctors. Arfan Mia, a relative of the family, who took them to the hospital, said that a fire spread at house 204/F, beside Paka Market Islamic Foundation, from a gas line leakage in the early hours on Saturday. The flames spread through the house immediately, burning everyone inside, he said, adding that, later, the six injured were rushed to the hospital. The family reportedly had been smelling gas in the house for more than a month and had repeatedly alerted the house owner but no repairs were made.
